alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 26 at 6:54PM CST until November 26 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 653 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across much of Mobile County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain with locally higher amounts may quickly fall in a short period of time. Excessive runoff from heavy rains will result in flooding in urban and low lying areas as well as ponding of water on some area roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Tillmans Corner, Saraland, Theodore, Chickasaw, Satsuma, Grand Bay, Citronelle, Bayou La Batre, Creola, Dauphin Island, Chunchula, Gulfcrest, Axis, Mount Vernon, Semmes, Tanner Williams and Mobile Regional Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
